heaviest_rainfall.status: Record-breaking rain fell on 04 January 2025 with a total accumulation of 36.8mm over 37.2 hours and falling at a rate of 4.6mm per hour at times.

heaviest_rainrate.status: A torrential downpour occurred on 02 September 2025 when the rain reached a maximum intensity of 27.0mm per hour.  This happened during a 15.0 hour storm when 21.19mm of rain fell.

longest_rain.status: Rain fell for 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 creating a new record that still lasts.  The storm produced a total of 36.8mm with a maximum intensity of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning strikes in one day since 11 April 2025 is 23 and it happened on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: There is a storm in the vicinity.  This is the first storm since 02 October 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: At the moment, it is not a cold snap.  This year has seen 6 cold snaps; typically, 3.7 cold snaps happen every year.

extreme.status: The maximum temperature difference seen is 26.7°C, observed on 29 April 2025 when the temperature fell to 0.4°C but also managed to reach 27.1°C on the same day.

heatwaves.status: There is currently no heatwaves.  This year there have been 6 heatwavess, usually there are 1.9 heatwavess per year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was 18 July 2025, there have been only 62 tropical nights since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (196°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: To date, the maximum wind gust recorded is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The highest wind run ever seen is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: To date, the maximum wind speed recorded is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 5.0°C) and outside temperature (up 3.9°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 9%) and rainfall (up 0.5 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 604 m) and light levels (up 2984 lux).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 1009 m) and light levels (up 6727 lux) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 604.5m lower than yesterday, 857.1m lower than the past week, 1008.6m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, cloud levels hit a low of 760m and a high of 2130m, averaging 727.0m; the past week and month reported somewhat higher averages.
cloud levels.summary: Fog or low cloud is expected.

Today’s average dew point temperature is 5.3°C higher than yesterday, 6.3°C higher than the past week, 34.5°C lower than the past month.

The dew point temperatures yesterday fell between 2.6°C minimum and 14.1°C maximum, with an average of 15.0°C; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 8.7°C and 49.5°C.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; pleasant, mild temperatures. Also, you’ll experience intense stickiness in the air and very little to no wind will be present. Drizzle or light rain possible, fog or low cloud is expected, and periods of sunshine are expected. Low pressure may bring unsettled weather.
